intro: Hapalostephium, commonly known as the common goldenweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species that are typically found in arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. The plants are characterized by their erect or spreading growth habit and are often covered in fine hairs. They produce small, yellow or orange flowers arranged in composite heads, which are typical of the Asteraceae family. Hapalostephium species are adapted to drought conditions and are often used in traditional medicine.
